title: Interior Minister calls for people-centred leadership
desc: The Minister for the Interior, Muntaka Mohammed-Mubarak, has emphasised that effective leadership in the public sector must prioritise people, communication and trust, rather than authority and hierarchy

title: Somalia: a grandmother’s fight against hunger
desc: The CaafimaadPlus Consortium is the largest health and nutrition consortium in Somalia. Led by Action Against Hunger, it is a group of 5 international and 4 local humanitarian organisations working together to deliver life-saving assistance to communities affected by drought and conflict in Somalia.
source: European Civil Protection and Humanitarian Aid Operations

title: Brighton 0-1 Crystal Palace analysis: Why derby day victory was extra sweet for the Palace hierarchy - plus the latest on Jean-Philippe Mateta's future at the club
desc: BOBBY MANZI: Decision makers at Crystal Palace will feel extremely chuffed with their transfer business after winning 1-0 at arch-rivals Brighton on Sunday.

title: ‘New Year New Me’ no longer just for January as everyday wellness drives health spending growth
desc: New analysis from Experian and Reward shows health spending now a year-round priority as wellbeing becomes a protected budget

title: Meta warned EU plans to impose measures to reverse WhatsApp AI policy
desc: The move follows the European Commission announcing an investigation in December into whether the social media giant had breached antitrust rules.

title: This photographer spent 10 years chasing the perfect shot of a rare species. This is how he got it
desc: South African wildlife photographer Wim van den Heever was crowned Wildlife Photographer of the Year. His winning shot of the elusive brown hyena was a decade in the making.

title: Maritime safety regulator investigating luxury Carnival cruise ship after whistleblower concerns
desc: The maritime union says crew members of a luxury Carnival cruise ship allege they are being made to sleep in crowded rooms, lack access to safe free drinking water, and that some are earning as little as $2.50 an hour.
